data.title: Grave Danger (2009)
data.meta_description: Home alone, Becky (Debbie Kopacz) is already on edge from a night of watching scary movies when an anonymous caller takes her terror to the brink by forcing her to trade spooky stories with him in this Jim Haggerty-helmed horror flick. Tales of murderous ventriloquist dummies, housewives ensnared by voodoo and more follow in an agonizing game of one-upmanship that could end up with Becky dead. Cathy St. George and Vic Martino co-star.
data.text:
I watched this compilation of shorts on Tubi a little while ago all done by Jim Haggerty. Honestly, I just thought it would kill some time and I'd dip in and out of this 2 and a half hour compilation through the week. Watched it all in two sittings. A real throwback to innocent trash cinema, where you had a "neato" concept (from the writer's perspective) and you just made sure to add boobs and blood. And heck, he'd throw in bums and hoo haws too. Some segments reminded me of Something Weird shorts, some of dirty student films and some just fun homages.

So, there was no way I wasn't going to check this out.

Liked it just as…

Jim Haggertys Grave Danger (2009)

Thanks @bloodsickproductions for reminding me of this .. ummm ... "gem".

A horror anthology where an obscene caller tells a woman three stories. Actually she tells him the second one. Seriously instead of hanging up she adds a story to drag it up. She's not even having fun doing it. Every story has a woman get naked so randomly that he totally makes it unsexy and literally funny. Just over half way through even the woman on the phone is told to get naked, so of course she does. The first story is a Twilight zone paranoia trip done SOV style. The second is the obligatory exotic statue from a junk shop makes bad things…
